poem:
### Correction & Clarification

Carved from time's own backdrop,  
pale blue whispers merge with red's bold cry,  
Hepworth's ovals sing against a backdrop of sky.  
In paper print a twist of fate,  
curator unnamed, art misstates—  
a sculpture's soul seeking to stay,  
its truth clarified by the light of day.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Corrections and clarifications • An article and an accompanying picture misidentified the Barbara Hepworth artwork that is the subject of a fundraising drive to keep it in the country (Battle to save early Hepworth masterpiece carved against the backdrop of world war, 5 June, p3). The artwork is Sculpture with Colour (Oval Form) Pale Blue and Red, not Sculpture with Colour (Deep Blue and Red). Also, we described Eleanor Clayton as “senior curator” at the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
